author: Simon Constable
title: 'Money Is Like Sex' And 24 Other Thought-Provoking Money Quotes
text:
On this scorching New York summer morning it’s worth remembering that not all words of money wisdom come from today’s business heros, like Yahoo Yahoo !’s Marissa Mayer , or Microsoft's Microsoft's Bill Gates or even Facebook’s Mark Zuckerberg. Some come from writers, comedians, or ancient philosophers. With that in mind, I have compiled a list of 25 thought provoking Quote: s on money that I found intriguing. For your convenience I included where I got the information (indirect sources in parentheses.) I hope you find these Quote: s as stimulating as I do. Enjoy:
“Money is like sex. It seems much more important if you don’t have any.” – Charles Bukowski (The Hip Pocket Guide to Offbeat Wisdom.)
“It’s like muck, not good except to be spread.” — Francis Bacon (It’s Only Money by Peter Pugh)
“I have no money, no resources, no hopes. I am the happiest man alive.” — Henry Miller (Brainy Quote: )
“That man is admired above all men, who is not influenced by money.” — Cicero (Delacorte’s Dictionary of Quotations)
“If you want to know what God thinks of money, just look at the people he gave it to.” — Dorothy Parker (The Hip Pocket Guide to Offbeat Wisdom)
“As a general rule, nobody has money who ought to have it.” — Benjamin Franklin. (The Hip Pocket Guide to Offbeat Wisdom)
F. Scott Fitzgerald: “Let me tell you about the very rich, they are different from you and me.” Earnest Hemingway: “Yes. They’ve got more money.” (Hawthornedirect)
“My money is like a big pillow or a soft blanket to fall back on or to wrap up in when I’m feeling low.” — Michael Phillips, The Seven Laws of Money.
